question: Identify  the  errors  in  the  given  sentence  and  choose  the sentence that rectiﬁes these errors. I  have  known  her  for  many  years.  This  time,  she  took  unusual decision in unprejudiced way. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Morning)

options.A: I have known her for many years. This time, she took an
options.B: I have known her for many years. This time, she took an
options.C: I have known her for many years. This time, she took a
options.D: I have known her for many years. This time, she took unusual

solution.correct_answer: B. I have known her for many years. This time, she took an
solution.explanation: I have known her for many years. This time, she took an unusual decision in an unprejudiced way. Article ‘an’ is used before words starting with a vowel sound (an apple, an umbrella, an American). Similarly, in the given sentence, the words ‘unusual’ and ‘unprejudiced’ start with a vowel sound. Hence, the sentence given in option (b) is correct.

question: My mom made her muﬃns, but  she didn't eat none  . SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: she didn’t eat any ‘None’ is not used in a negative sentence. ‘None’ must be replaced with ‘any’ as we use ‘any’ in a negative sentence. Hence, “she didn’t eat any” is the most appropriate answer.

question: Identify  the  error  in  the  given  sentence  and  select  the correct sentence from the given options. Tide  pool  is  a  isolated  pocket  of  water  that  is  formed  when  sea water becomes trapped as tide goes out. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Evening)

options.A: A tide pool is a isolated pocket of water that is formed when
options.B: A tide pool is an isolated pocket of water that is formed when
options.C: Tide pool is isolated pocket of water that is formed when sea
options.D: The tide pool is isolated pocket of water that is formed when

solution.correct_answer: B. A tide pool is an isolated pocket of water that is formed when
solution.explanation: A tide pool is an isolated pocket of water that is formed when sea water becomes trapped as the tide goes out. Indeﬁnite article ‘a/an’ is used when we talk about a noun in general. Similarly, the given sentence talks about ‘tide pool’ and ‘isolated pocket’ in a general sense. We will use article ‘a’ before ‘tide’ (consonant sound) and article ‘an’ before ‘isolated’(vowel sound). Article ‘the’ will be used before the 2 nd ‘tide’. Hence, the sentence given in option (b) is correct.

question: He  behaves  if  he were a king. SSC Stenographer 10/12/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: behaves as if ‘As if’ is used to talk about a situation that may not be true but that is possible. Similarly, in the given sentence, the person may not be a king but he behaves like a king. Hence, ‘behaves as if’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: What  do  you  like  to  do  on  your  free  days  other  than  to watching movies  ? SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: watching movies We use a noun, pronoun or a gerund(V ing ) after the phrase ‘other than’. Therefore, ‘to’ will be removed. Hence, ‘watching(V ing ) movies’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the correct version of the following sentence. He would be meet us next week. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Afternoon)

options.A: He would be meets us next week.
options.B: He would not be met us next week.
options.C: He will be meet us next week.
options.D: He will be meeting us next week.

solution.correct_answer: D. He will be meeting us next week.
solution.explanation: He will be meeting us next week. The given sentence is in the future continuous tense and follows the structure, “Third person pronoun + will + be + V ing ”. Hence, the sentence given in option (d) is correct.

question: While  I  was  waiting  for  Asha  for  shopping  ,  I  spilled lemonade on my new trousers SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: to shop Inﬁnitive(to + V 1 ) is used after the verb ‘wait’. Therefore, ‘for shopping’ must be replaced with ‘to shop(V 1 )’. Hence, ‘to shop’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Whether  she  wishes  to  relocate  to  Mumbai  or  continues  to live here  are her personal decisions  . SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Evening)

options.C: No substitution required     (d) have her personal decision

solution.explanation: is her personal decision ‘Whether … or’ is a pair of conjunctions. According to the “Rule of Proximity”, the verb is supplied according to the subject closest

question: He  gave  his  heart  and  soul  to  make  the  entire  show  a success. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Evening)

options.C: offer of peace and harmony     (d) entire energy and effort

solution.explanation: Heart and soul- entire energy and effort.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  option  that  can  substitute (replace) the bracketed segment in the following sentence. I look forward (see) you soon. SSC Stenographer 11/12/2024 (Evening)

options.A: into see     (b) to seeing     (c) to see     (d) on seeing

solution.explanation: to seeing There are some phrases that are always followed by a gerund(V ing ). Such phrases are ‘with a view to, looking forward to, in addition to, accustomed to, habituated to, be used to, prone to, etc.’ Hence, ‘look forward to seeing’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Harish is  clever than  wise. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: more clever than When we compare two qualities of the same person, the comparative degree is formed by adding ‘more’, not by adding ‘-er’. Hence, ‘more clever than’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  phrasal  verb  that  can substitute the underlined segment in the given sentence. The ﬁreﬁghters tried their best to  extinguish  the  ﬁre. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

options.A: put off        (b) put in       (c) put out        (d) put on

solution.explanation: Put out- to extinguish ﬁre.

question: Research  in  Social  Sciences  is  plagued  nowadays  on gloomy deﬁnitions  and measurements. SSC CHSL Tier II  (18/11/2024)

solution.explanation: nowadays by gloomy deﬁnitions ‘By’ is used in passive voice to indicate the doer or agent of the action. Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘by’ has been used to indicate the doer of the action ‘plagued’. Hence, ‘nowadays by gloomy deﬁnitions’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Raghav,  who  studies  tourism  at  present,  is  planning  to  go abroad after his graduation. SSC MTS 01/10/2024 (Morning)

options.A: will study      (b) study      (c) studied      (d) is studying

solution.explanation: is studying Present continuous tense is used to indicate an action that is in progress in the present. ‘Singular Subject + is + V ing ’ is the correct grammatical structure for it. Hence, ‘is studying’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Placing  a  huge  magnet  atop  the  temple  pose  to  being  the biggest hurdle for the masons. SSC MTS 01/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: posed to be ‘To + V 1 ’, also known as inﬁnitive, is the correct grammatical structure. The given sentence is in the past tense, therefore, the past form(V 2 ) of the verb will be used. Hence, ‘posed to be’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: One  of  the  most  horriﬁed  serials  of  the  Indian  television industry was broadcast twenty years ago. SSC MTS 07/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: most horrifying serials ‘Horrifying’ means causing a feeling of horror. The given sentence states that one of the most horrifying serials of the Indian television industry was broadcast twenty years ago. Hence, ‘most horrifying serials’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Monika  said  to  her  mother  that,  "I  have  passed  the examination." SSC MTS 08/10/2024 (Morning)

options.A: Monika said to her mother that, "I am passed
options.B: Monika said to her mother, "I have passed
options.D: Monika said to her mother that, "she has passed

solution.correct_answer: B. Monika said to her mother, "I have passed
solution.explanation: Monika said to her mother, “I have passed If the reported speech is given in inverted commas(“ ” ), it is called direct speech. However, in the direct speech, we do not use any conjunctions (‘that’, ‘if’, ‘whether’) after the reporting verb (say). Therefore, ‘that’ will be removed from the given sentence. Hence, option (b) is the most appropriate answer.

question: If she  had gone to the party  , she could have  met Amit. SSC MTS 14/10/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: No substitution required. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: Heba  dropped  of  the  club  unexpectedly  to  say  hello  and catch up. SSC MTS 15/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.correct_answer: C. dropped by the club unexpectedly
solution.explanation: dropped by the club unexpectedly The phrasal verb ‘drop by’ means to pay a brief casual visit. The given sentence states that Heba dropped by the club unexpectedly to say hello and catch up. Hence, ‘dropped by the club unexpectedly’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Solving  the  riddle  given  by  our  teacher  is  farther  beyond our capacity. SSC MTS 16/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: far Positive degree ‘far’ will be used in this sentence as there is no comparison. Hence, ‘far’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Rohit  Sharma  is  better  than  more  other  batsman  in  the world. SSC MTS 18/10/2024 (Afternoon)

options.D: as good as the most other batsmen

solution.correct_answer: C. better than most other batsmen
solution.explanation: better than most other batsmen ‘More other’ must be replaced with ‘most other’, indicating the majority of other batsmen. Plural noun is used with the adjective ‘other’. The given sentence states that Rohit Sharma is better than the majority of other batsmen in the world. Hence, ‘better than most other batsmen’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: There  have  been  numerous  attempts  made  by  the  citizens to restore parity. SSC MTS 21/10/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: No substitution The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: The  given  sentence  has  an  error.  Select  the  option  that correctly rectiﬁes the error. India is not on war with Pakistan. SSC MTS 21/10/2024 (Evening)

options.A: at Pakistan    (b) for Pakistan    (c) not at    (d) not of

solution.explanation: not at ‘At war with’ is the correct phrase, which means to be in a situation of war with an enemy nation. Hence, ‘not at’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  following  sentence  contains  an  error.  Select  the option that correctly rectiﬁes the error. The  robbers  stabbed  him  by  a  sharp  knife  and  he  started bleeding profusely on the spot. SSC MTS 28/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: with a sharp knife ‘With’ is used when there is a physical contact between two things. When a person is stabbed with a knife, the knife enters a person’s body, indicating a physical contact. Hence, ‘with a sharp knife’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  intersection  of  nature  conservation  and  social  justice is  evident  in  efforts  to  ensure  that  marginalised  communities and  other  backward  classes  should  have  equal  access  to  natural reserves. SSC MTS 28/10/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.correct_answer: C. apparent in endeavours to guarantee
solution.explanation: apparent in endeavours to guarantee ‘Endeavour’ means an attempt to achieve a goal. ‘Guarantee’ means to ensure that something will happen. The phrase ‘evident in efforts to ensure’ means the same as ‘apparent in endeavours to guarantee’. Hence, ‘apparent in endeavours to guarantee’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I had to choose the  best of  the two options available. SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (Afternoon)

options.A: good of      (b) better of      (c) better than       (d) best than

solution.explanation: better of ‘Than’ is used when one thing is before the comparative degree and the other comes afterwards. But when we talk about one out of two, ‘of’ is used with comparative degree. The given sentence talks about the one better option out of two options available. Hence, ‘better of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: After  the  heavy  rains  last  Thursday,  the  water  in  the  river raised another three feet  . SSC MTS 05/11/2024 (Afternoon)

options.A: rose another three feet        (b) will raise another three feet
options.C: risen another three feet       (d) raise another three feet

solution.correct_answer: A. rose another three feet        (b) will raise another three feet
solution.explanation: rose another three feet ‘Raised’ must be replaced with ‘rose’. ‘Raise’ means to cause something to move upwards. ‘Rose’ means to go upwards or higher. ‘Rose’ is the past form of ‘rise’, indicating simple past tense. Hence, ‘rose another three feet’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Ramgopal  is having  a very big house in Mumbai. SSC MTS 11/11/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: has ‘Have’ is a stative verb denoting possession. Stative verbs are generally not used in the continuous tense. Rather, we use simple present tense to talk about the present state. ‘Ramgopal’

question: I have  never had  and never will be dependent  on him. SSC MTS 11/11/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: never been In the given sentence, the main verb is ‘be’. With ‘has/have/had’, the third form of the verb is used. The ﬁrst form of the verb is used with modals (will, shall, can, may, might, could, would, should, must). Hence, ‘never been(V 3 )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Rahul was angry  of  his brother as he broke his  pen. SSC MTS 11/11/2024 (Evening)

solution.explanation: at ‘At’ is used with ‘angry’ for a person. ‘Angry at someone’ is the correct phrase. Hence, ‘at’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  pineapple  dessert  was  so  delicious  that  we  couldn’t help eat it  . SSC MTS 12/11/2024 (Morning)

options.A: so delicious that we couldn’t helping eat it
options.B: so that delicious we couldn’t help eating it
options.D: so delicious that we couldn’t help eating it

solution.correct_answer: D. so delicious that we couldn’t help eating it
solution.explanation: so delicious that we couldn’t help eating it The phrase “ can’t help / couldn’t help ” is used when you can not resist doing something. Present participle(V ing ) is used after this phrase. Hence, “so delicious that we couldn’t help eating it” is the most appropriate answer.

question: Autumn  leaves  shuﬄed  beneath  him  as  he  wandered through the quiet forest. SSC MTS 13/11/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: rustled underfoot ‘Rustle’ means to make a soft sound, as by moving leaves. ‘Underfoot’ means under your feet as you walk. The given sentence states that autumn leaves rustled underfoot as he wandered through the quiet forest. Hence, ‘rustled underfoot’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: If  we  want  to  promote  national  integrity  in  our  country, then we must desist our tendency of  taking up with  others. SSC MTS 14/11/2024 (Morning)

solution.explanation: looking down upon ‘Taking up with’ must be replaced with the phrasal verb ‘looking down upon’, which means to treat someone as unimportant or not worthy of respect. The given sentence talks about desisting the tendency of looking down upon others. Hence, ‘looking down upon’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: .She  conﬁded  in  me  on  her  anxious  ,  whispering  her  secrets between sips of coffee. SSC MTS 14/11/2024 (Afternoon)

solution.explanation: about her anxiety Preposition ‘about’ is used to indicate the speciﬁc subject or issue. We use a noun after any preposition. ‘Anxiety’ is the correct noun to use here. ‘Anxiety’ means a feeling of worry, nervousness or unease about something. Hence, ‘about her anxiety’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: ‘Spy  Family’  is  a  graphic  novel  that  is  a  narrative  work  in which  the  story  is  conveyed  to  the  reader  using  uninterrupted  art in a traditional  comics format. SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. sequential art in a traditional
solution.explanation: sequential art in a traditional ‘Sequential’ means in a logical order. The given sentence states that ‘Spy Family’ is a graphic novel that is a narrative work in which the story is conveyed to the reader using sequential art in a traditional comics format. Hence, 'sequential art in a traditional' is the most appropriate answer.

question: She has been  studying for two o’clock . SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (1st Shift)

options.A: study from two o’clock     (b) studying since two o’clock
options.C: study for two o’clock         (d) studying two o’clock

solution.explanation: studying since two o’clock ‘Since’ is used to indicate the point of time when something started. Similarly, the given sentence states the time when she started studying. Hence, “studying since two o’ clock” is the most appropriate answer.

question: Spreading  awareness  about  the  rights  of  the  consumers and  the  relief  open  to  them  in  case  they  did  not  get  their  money’s worth  of  goods  and  service  has  rightly  been  identiﬁed  as  the  ﬁrst priority. SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.A: were unable to get their money’s worth
options.C: did not getting their money’s worth
options.D: will not get their money’s worth

solution.correct_answer: A. were unable to get their money’s worth
solution.explanation: were unable to get their money’s worth The phrase ‘did not get’ means to not be able to get something in the past. ‘Unable’ means to not be able to do something. Hence, “were unable to get their money’s worth” is the most appropriate answer.

question: Pollution  levels  have  increased  so  largely  that  they  are almost killing us. SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: highly ‘Highly’ means at a high level. The given sentence states that pollution levels have increased so highly that they are almost killing us. Hence, 'highly' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select the word segment that can substitute  the bracketed  word  segment  correctly  and  complete  the  sentence meaningfully. (Each participant have) performed well. SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

options.A: Each participant was                 (b) Each participant has
options.C: Each participant have been      (d) Each participant were

solution.explanation: Each participant has ‘Everyone/each/ every/ nothing/ everything/ anything/ either/ neither’ represents a singular noun. Therefore, singular verbs will be used with them. Hence, ‘Each participant has’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: There are many factories in the  operative  area  of the city. SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: industrial ‘Industrial’ means having a lot of factories. The given sentence states that there are many factories in the industrial area of the city. Hence, 'industrial' is the most appropriate answer.

question: I have been living in Hyderabad since I am born  . SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: since I was born ‘Since’ is used to indicate the point of time in the past when something began. Therefore, past tense will be used in the clause beginning with ‘since’. Hence, ‘since I was born’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Rare  species  of  frogs  were  very  quicker  identiﬁed  by Stella. SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.A: to frogs were very quickly        (b) of frogs were very quickly
options.C: in frogs were very quicker        (d) of frogs were very quicklier

solution.explanation: of frogs were very quickly The given sentence needs an adverb ‘quickly’ to modify the verb ‘identiﬁed’, not an adjective ‘quicker’. Hence, ‘of frogs were very quickly’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He  was  an  irresponsible  person  to  the  matter  of  taking  up responsibilities. SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.C: by the matter of taking up      (d) along the matter of taking up

solution.explanation: in the matter of taking up ‘In’ is used to indicate a speciﬁc situation or circumstance. The given passage states that he was an irresponsible person in the matter of taking up responsibilities. Hence, 'in the matter of taking up' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Select  the  option  that  can  substitute/replace  the  bracketed word correctly and complete the sentence. They could (always) stay in, or go for a walk. SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

options.A: had better     (b) not only     (c) either      (d) neither

solution.explanation: either ‘Either…or’ is a ﬁxed pair of conjunctions. Hence, ‘either’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Charles  Darwin  is  renowned  for  his  book  on  evolution,  ‘On the Origin of Species’, which laid down a treasure ofsubstantiation  that  evolution  occurs,  and  projected  a mechanism, that is, natural selection, for how it does so. SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (1st Shift)

options.B: laid about a treasure of substantiation
options.C: laid away a treasure of substantiation
options.D: laid out a treasure of substantiation

solution.correct_answer: D. laid out a treasure of substantiation
solution.explanation: laid out a treasure of substantiation ‘Laid out’ means explained or described something in a clear and detailed way. The given sentence states that Charles Darwin is renowned for his book on evolution, ‘On the Origin of Species’, which laid down a treasure of substantiation that evolution occurs. Hence, ‘laid out a treasure of substantiation’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  programme  on  TV  was  now  shown  the  blurring  faces of the inmates of the rehabilitation centre  . SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.A: were now showing the blurred faces of the inmates of the
options.B: was now showing the blurred faces of the inmates of the
options.C: were now showing the blurring faces of the inmates from the
options.D: was now showing the blurred faces of the inmates upon the

solution.correct_answer: B. was now showing the blurred faces of the inmates of the
solution.explanation: was now showing the blurred faces of the inmates of the rehabilitation centre ‘Singular Sub. + was + V ing ’ is grammatically the correct structure

question: When  I  saw  him  ,  I  will  ask  him  to  return  the  book  he borrowed. SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

options.A: shall see him         (b) have seen him

solution.explanation: see him If ‘when’ is used to denote the time of a future event, it is used in simple present tense. First form of the verb is used with pronoun ‘I’ in the simple present tense. Hence, ‘see(V 1 ) him’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Gourav was  no good  than a foolish person. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: no better We use comparative degree with ‘than’ to make comparison. However, ‘better’ is the comparative degree of ‘good’. Hence, ‘no better’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: If  I  was  the  queen  ,  I  would  give  a  handsome  sum  towards education. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: were the queen The phrase ‘If i were’ is generally used in the subjunctive mood to talk about possibilities, wishes, or conditions that are contrary to reality. ‘If I were… (would + V 1 ) / (would have + V 3 )’ is the correct grammatical structure. Hence, ‘If I were the queen’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Five  years  later,  I  was  eating  this  same  dish  at  the  same restaurant. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: am eating The given sentence implies that the person ate a dish at a restaurant and ﬁve years later, he is eating the same dish at the same restaurant. Therefore, the sentence will be written in simple present tense. Hence, ‘am eating’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Beyond  skills,  experience,  and  training,  companies  search for  applicants  who  display  excitement  —  those  they  believe  shall carry out allocated responsibilities  cheerfully and  cooperatively. SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

options.A: shall take up any designated obligations
options.D: should pick up all skills and works

solution.explanation: will execute assigned duties ‘Execute’ means to carry out fully. ‘Duties’ means responsibility. The given sentence states that beyond skills, experience, and training, companies search for applicants who display excitement — those they believe will execute assigned duties cheerfully and cooperatively. Hence, ‘will execute assigned duties’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  mother  asked  the  child,  “Will  you  tell  me  who  did accompany you  to the airport?” SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

options.A: who accompanies you        (b) who does accompany you
options.C: who accompanied you        (d) who must be accompaniedyou

solution.correct_answer: C. who accompanied you        (d) who must be accompaniedyou
solution.explanation: who accompanied you When a question is part of a sentence, the helping verb is written after the subject, not before the subject. Past form (V 2 ) is used in simple past tense. Hence, ‘who accompanied(V 2 ) you’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Satya  is  always  great  to  his  friends  who  helped  him  when he was in trouble. SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: grateful ‘Grateful’ means showing appreciation for something done. The given sentence states that Satya is always grateful to his friends who helped him when he was in trouble. Hence, ‘grateful’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  team  always  anticipate  a  bowling  friendly  pitch  on their easy victory  in the T20 matches. SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (1st Shift)

options.A: pitch over their easy victory     (b) pitch for their easy victory
options.C: pitch to their easy victory         (d) pitch of their easy victory

solution.explanation: pitch for their easy victory ‘For’ is used to indicate the purpose or reason for something. Similarly, the team anticipate a bowling friendly pitch for the purpose of easy victory in the T20 matches. Hence, ‘pitch for their easy victory’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The wedding was  put on  until January. SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.A: put in       (b) put off      (c) put down      (d) put up

solution.explanation: put off The phrasal verb ‘put off’ means to delay something until a later time. The given sentence states that the wedding was put off until January. Hence, ‘put off’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Everyone  called  the  reporter  a  daredevil  after  he  came back safely from the war zone. SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: A daredevil- a fearless person.

question: Carnatic  music  is  usually  performed  by  a  small  troupe  of actors  , consisting  of  a  principal  performer,  a  melodic accompaniment, and a rhythm accompaniment. SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: ensemble of musicians ‘Ensemble’ means a group of musicians, dancers, or actors who perform together. The given sentence talks about carnatic music, so the correct phrase to use is ‘ensemble of musicians’. Hence, ‘ensemble of musicians’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It  is  very  hard  for  her  to  provide  the  necessities  of  her family  . SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. the necessities to her family
solution.explanation: the necessities to her family ‘To’ is used to indicate the receiver of an action or object. In the given sentence, ‘her family’ is the receiver of the necessities. Hence, ‘the necessities to her family’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: To  the  general  public,  William  was  best  known  as  a crusader  for  peace  and  as  an  admired  critic  about  social, political and ethical subjects. SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift)

options.A: for peace and as an admired critic by
options.B: for peace and as an admired critic on
options.C: about peace and as an admired critic about
options.D: in peace and as an admired critic about

solution.correct_answer: B. for peace and as an admired critic on
solution.explanation: for peace and as an admired critic on ‘On’ is generally used to indicate the topic or subject of discussion. Hence, ‘on’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: No  matter  how  hard  work  you  ,  your  boss  will  not  recognise your efforts. SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (1st Shift)

options.A: hard you work              (b) work you do hard

solution.correct_answer: A. hard you work              (b) work you do hard
solution.explanation: hard you work ‘Subject + main verb’ is the correct order for the sentence. ‘You’ is the subject and ‘work’ is its main verb. Hence, ‘hard you work’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: As  the  rulers  of  the  planet,  humans  like  to  think  that  it  is the  largest  creatures  that  will  emerge  victorious  from  the struggle for survival. SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

options.A: No substitution                        (b) it is the most large creatures
options.C: they are a largest creature     (d) they are the largest creatures

question: Select  the  most  appropriate  option  that  can  replace  the bracketed word segment in the following sentence. question: I  gave  my  best  dress  to  her  on  condition  that  she  return  it the very next day in a clean condition. SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: Select the option that corrects the following  sentence. All tickets of the FIFA World Cup have been sold away. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: Employers  in  many  developing  countries  report  that  a lack  of  skilled  workers  is  a  major  and  increasing  bottleneck  for their operations,  affected their capacity  to innovate. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: He asked his father when  would come the next  letter  . SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

question: Although  I  have  a  lot  of  work  to  do,  I  am  determined  to ﬁnish  it  all  by  the  end  of  the  day  so  that  I  can  enjoy  my  weekend not having any imminent due dates  . SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (3rd Shift)

question: Youth is the time when  the seeds of character  is sown  . SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: go through ‘Go through’ is a phrasal verb which means to study something in detail. The given sentence states that you all need to go through the books prescribed in your syllabus. Hence, ‘go through’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  faced  a  session  of  abuse  after  insisting  that  she  was too beautiful to be liked. Graduate Level 21/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: tirade of abuse ‘Tirade of abuse’ is the correct phrase to use here. It means a long angry speech in which someone criticies a person. The given sentence states that she faced a tirade of abuse after insisting that she was too beautiful to be liked. Hence, ‘tirade of abuse’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This secret will remain  between you and I  . Graduate Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: between you and me A preposition takes an objective case pronoun after it. ‘Between’ is a preposition that will take ‘me’ instead of ‘I’. Hence, ‘between you and me’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  plot  of  the  story  effects  the  character  and  their growth. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: affects the character The given sentence needs a verb, not the noun ‘effects’ for the subject ‘the plot of the story’. ‘The plot of the story’ is a singular subject that will take ‘affects’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘affects the character’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  enigma  of  quantum  mechanics  remains  inscrutably elusive  despite  of  decades  of  intensive  research  by  the  world's leading physicists. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

options.A: despite of decades in         (b) despite decades of
options.C: despite of decades to         (d) despite decades with

solution.explanation: despite decades of ‘Despite’ does not take ‘of’. Therefore, ‘of’ will be removed. Hence, ‘despite decades of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The train  left before I reached  the station. Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.correct_answer: B. had left  before I reached
solution.explanation: had left before I reached If two actions took place in the past then the 1st action must be in the Past perfect tense (Had + V 3 ) and the 2nd action must be in the Simple Past tense(V 2 ). In the given sentence, ‘train leaving’ is the ﬁrst action, so it will be written in past perfect tense. Hence, ‘had left(V 3 ) before I reached(V 2 )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She met my cousin,  whose she later married  . Graduate Level 26/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

options.C: which she later married         (d) No substitution required

solution.explanation: whom she later married ‘Whom’ is a relative pronoun used for the object in a relative clause. In the underlined part, ‘whom’ has been used for the person she married. Hence, ‘whom she later married’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  decided  to  call  out  to  various  bookstores  in  the  area  to see if any of them had the book I needed. SSC CHSL Tier II  (02/11/2023)

options.A: call on (b) No substitution required (c) call around (d) call off

solution.explanation: call around The phrasal verb ‘call around’ means to phone different people or places. The given sentence states that I decided to make phone calls to various bookstores in the area to see if any of them had the book I needed. Hence, ‘call around’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This  lesser  known  heritage  building  is  so  beautiful  as  the Red Fort. SSC CHSL Tier II  (02/11/2023)

options.A: This less known heritage building is much beautiful than the
options.B: This heritage building is as beautiful as the Red Fort.
options.C: This lesser known heritage building is very much beautiful as
options.D: This lesser known heritage building is as much beautiful as

solution.correct_answer: D. This lesser known heritage building is as much beautiful as
solution.explanation: This lesser known heritage building is as much beautiful as the Red Fort. ‘So…as’ is used with ‘not’ to show that two things are not equal. ‘As…as’ or ‘As much… as’ is used to show that two things are equal in certain respects. According to option (d), the lesser known building and the Red fort are equally beautiful. Hence, option (d) has the correct sentence.

question: Parts  of  the  given  sentence  have  been  underlined.  One  of the  parts  may  contain  an  error.  Select  the  option  that  rectiﬁes the error. If you don’t ﬁnd any error, mark ‘No error’ as your answer. It  was  the  home  minister  of  the  country  who  took  the  decision  to change  a  laws  pertaining  to  migration  of  people  from  one  state to another. SSC CHSL Tier II  (02/11/2023)

solution.explanation: the laws pertaining Article ‘a’ must be replaced with ‘the’. The ‘laws’ mentioned in the given sentence are speciﬁc and we generally use the deﬁnite article ‘the’ before any speciﬁc or particular noun. Hence, ‘the laws pertaining’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Parts  of  the  given  sentence  have  been  underlined.  One  of them  contains  an  error.  The  underlined  parts  are  given  as options  with  some  changes.  Select  the  option  that  correctly rectiﬁes the error. The  ﬁlm  received  critical  acclaim  for  being  a  more  innovative movie  of the year  . SSC CHSL Tier II  (02/11/2023)

options.A: Film receives  (b) Acclaim at  (c) In the year  (d) An innovative

solution.explanation: An innovative ‘More’ must be removed as there is no comparison in this sentence. Article ‘a’ must be replaced with article ‘an’ as we use ‘an’ before words starting with a vowel sound (an apple, an umbrella, an MBA). Hence, ‘an innovative’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I will deﬁnitely  return your notes at  Saturday  evening. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

options.C: No improvement required     (d) return your notes by

solution.explanation: return your notes by Preposition ‘by’ is used to indicate a deadline or a speciﬁc time before which the action will be completed. The given sentence states that the notes will be returned by evening. Hence, ‘return your notes by’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: My  sister  resembles  to  my  mother  a  lot  in  looks  and  in temperament. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: resembles The verb ‘resembles’ does not take the preposition ‘to’ after it. Hence, ‘resembles’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Effective  communication  is  a  skill  that  can  signiﬁcant enhance  your personal and professional life. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: which can signiﬁcantly enhance The given sentence needs an adverb(signiﬁcantly) to modify the verb (enhance) and not an adjective (signiﬁcant). Hence, ‘which can signiﬁcantly enhance’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  have  received  no  information  so  far  to  the  main island. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

options.A: No improvement required       (b) so farther from

solution.explanation: so far from ‘From’ is used with ‘receive’ to indicate the source destination or sender. In the given sentence, ‘the main island’ is the source destination from which no information has been received so far. Hence, ‘so far from’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: When  he  was  falsely  accused  of  embezzlement,  he  was beside himself  in anger. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

options.C: he were beside himself      (d) he was besides himself

solution.explanation: No improvement ‘Be beside oneself’ is a phrase which means to be in an extremely emotional state. The given sentence states that the person was in an extreme state of anger. Hence, option (a) is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  is  married  with  a  rich  businessman  and  has  enough money to splurge on luxuries. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: is married to ‘To’ is used after the verb ‘married’ in the passive voice. Hence, 'is married to' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Sherpas  have  prospered  and  come  along  the  way  from being just porters to becoming mountaineers. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: come a long way The phrase ‘come a long way’ means to make signiﬁcant progress or improvement. The given sentence states that Sherpas have prospered and made signiﬁcant progress from being just porters to becoming mountaineers. Hence, ‘come a long way’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: You have a lot of coconut trees in your village,  do you  ? SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: don’t you? According to the “Question Tag rule”, if the statement is positive, the question tag will be negative & Vice-versa. However, the sentence and the question tag must be in the same tense. Similarly, the given sentence is positive so the question tag will be negative(don’t). Hence, ‘don’t you?’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: By  next  summer,  I  will  have  completed  my  internship  and will have returned to school. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

options.A: No improvement required       (b) have returned to school.

solution.explanation: returned to school If two or more verbs are of the same tense then the helping verb is written only once before the ﬁrst verb. In the given sentence, ‘will have’ is a helping verb of future perfect tense and has been used for both verbs (‘completed’ and ‘returned’). Hence, ‘returned to school’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Tomorrow,  they  will  be  take  a  ﬂight  to  their  dream vacation  destination. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.correct_answer: D. will be taking a ﬂight
solution.explanation: will be taking a ﬂight ‘Will be / shall be + V ing ’ is the correct grammatical structure of Future continuous tense. Hence, ‘will be taking (V ing ) a ﬂight’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: As bombs keep falling on Gaza, hundreds of  thousands of children  have been order to ﬂee  their homes. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

options.A: have been ordered to ﬂee      (b) have been ordered ﬂeeing
options.C: No improvement required     (d) has been ordered to ﬂee

solution.correct_answer: A. have been ordered to ﬂee      (b) have been ordered ﬂeeing
solution.explanation: have been ordered to ﬂee ‘Subject + has/have + been + V 3 ’ is the correct grammatical structure for passive voice of Present perfect tense. ‘Ordered’ is the correct third form of ‘order’. Hence, ‘have been ordered(V 3 ) to ﬂee’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The pollution level  ought to keep  under control. SSC CPO Tier II (08/01/2024)

solution.explanation: ought to be kept under Passive voice is used when the action is performed upon the subject, not by the subject. ‘Ought to + be + V 3 ’ is the correct passive form. Hence, ‘ought to be kept(V 3 ) under’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This is the  challenge  task I have ever encountered. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

solution.explanation: most challenging Deﬁnite article ‘the’ is used for a speciﬁc or particular thing and before a superlative degree adjective. ‘Most challenging’ is the correct superlative degree of ‘challenging’. Hence, ‘most challenging’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Ashoka  was  not  only  a  great  warrior  but  also  a  very  wiser ruler. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

options.A: more wise   (b) No correction required   (c) wisest   (d) wise

solution.explanation: wise ‘Very’ is a positive adverb and takes a positive degree adjective after it. Hence, ‘wise’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Cinema provides  the most universal  entertainment. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

solution.explanation: a universal There are some adjectives that can not be written in comparative or superlative degree. These adjectives are called absolute or non-gradable adjectives. Some examples are universal, absolute, complete, perfect, empty, full, etc. Hence, ‘a universal’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He is taller and  most  handsome than his friend. SSC CGL Tier II  (26/10/2023)

solution.explanation: more If two or more adjectives are joined with a conjunction, these adjectives are written in the same degree. In the given sentence, ‘and’ joins two adjectives, out of which one is comparative degree(taller). Therefore, the second adjective will also be written in comparative degree. ‘More handsome’ is the correct comparative degree of ‘handsome’. Hence, ‘more’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Lots  of  kids  (was  visualised)  crossing  the  road  when  the bus arrived. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: have been seen   (b) was seen   (c) are seen   (d) were seen

solution.explanation: were seen According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb and a plural subject always takes a plural verb. In the given sentence, ‘lots of kids’ is a plural subject that will take ‘were’ as a plural verb. Hence, ‘were seen’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  use  of  chemicals,  insecticides  and  pesticides  began after the Green Revolution. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: A practice of chemicals, insecticides and pesticides
options.B: The custom of chemicals, insecticides and pesticides
options.C: Consumption of chemicals, insecticides and pesticides
options.D: The usage of chemicals, insecticides and pesticides

solution.correct_answer: D. The usage of chemicals, insecticides and pesticides
solution.explanation: The usage of chemicals, insecticides and pesticides ‘Use’ means the act of utilizing something for a speciﬁc purpose while ‘Usage’ means the customary or habitual manner in which something is utilized. Hence, ‘The usage of chemicals, insecticides and pesticides’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Identify  the  sentence  that  correctly  uses  the  indeﬁnite article. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: There are three cars parked outside: a Mercedes, an Jaguar
options.B: There are three cars parked outside: an Mercedes, a Jaguar
options.C: There are three cars parked outside: a Mercedes, a Jaguar
options.D: There are three cars parked outside: a  Mercedes, an Jaguar

solution.correct_answer: C. There are three cars parked outside: a Mercedes, a Jaguar
solution.explanation: There are three cars parked outside: a Mercedes, a Jaguar and a Fiat.(Correct) (a) There are three cars parked outside: a Mercedes, an Jaguar and an Fiat .(Incorrect Article) (b) There are three cars parked outside: an Mercedes , a Jaguar and a Fiat.(Incorrect Article) (d) There are three cars parked outside: a Mercedes, an Jaguar and a Fiat.(Incorrect Article)

question: He is  faster than smarter  . SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: more fast than smart When there is a comparison between two qualities of a single person or thing, we do not use normal comparative degree. E.g.- more smart than beautiful(not ‘smarter than beautiful’). Similarly, the given sentence compares two qualities, ‘fast’ and ‘smart’. Hence, ‘more fast and smart’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  Taj  Mahal  is  one  of  the  much  popular  seven  wonders of the world. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: much more  (b) more  (c) most  (d) No substitution required

solution.explanation: most “One of the + Superlative degree adjective + Plural Subject” is grammatically the correct structure. For example, one of the best men, one of the greatest kings, one of the worst phones, etc. Hence, ‘most’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She  trusted  her  husband  but  he  stabbed  her  in  the  neck when he usurped her inheritance. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: snapped her in the neck        (b) stabbed her in the back
options.C: stabbed her with a fork         (d) stabbed her prospects

solution.explanation: stabbed her in the back ‘Stabbed her in the back’ is the correct idiom that means to be unfaithful or disloyal to. The given sentence states that she trusted her husband but he was unfaithful to her when he usurped her inheritance. Hence, ‘stabbed her in the back’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I  like  to  read  books,  but  my  brother  prefers  to  watching movies. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: No substitution  (b) to watch  (c) in watching  (d) on watching

solution.explanation: to watch We generally use an inﬁnitive(V 1 ) with the preposition ‘to’. Hence, ‘to watch’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This  case  is  serious.  You  need  to  look  into  this  matter; otherwise, the situation will get out of control soon. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: look after    (b) No substitution    (c) look up    (d) look at

solution.explanation: No substitution. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: The  village  Seoni  is  located  113  km  away  from  the capital city of MP, Bhopal. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: adjacent from city capital of MP,  Bhopal
options.B: proximate from capital of MP, Bhopal
options.C: near from the city capital of MP,  Bhopal
options.D: far from the capital city of MP, Bhopal

solution.correct_answer: D. far from the capital city of MP, Bhopal
solution.explanation: far from the capital city of MP, Bhopal ‘Far’ means situated at a distance or away from a place. Hence, ‘far from the capital city of MP, Bhopal’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Kiran's teacher was  doubtful on  her success. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: doubtful of ‘Of’ is a ﬁxed preposition used after the word ‘doubtful’. Hence, ‘doubtful of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Harry is the one sitting  on  the corner. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: in      (b) No substitution required      (c) onto      (d) upon

solution.correct_answer: A. in      (b) No substitution required      (c) onto      (d) upon
solution.explanation: in ‘In’ is used to indicate the location or position of an object or a person. Similarly, in the given sentence, ‘corner’ is the position of Harry. Hence, ‘in’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  Board  of  Film  Analysts  vituperated  the  novice Indonesian  ﬁlm-maker  and  cancelled  its  nomination  for  the 'Golden Globe Award'. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: dealt in a delicate and polite manner
options.B: recognised and praised the talent of
options.C: censured with harsh and abusive language

solution.correct_answer: C. censured with harsh and abusive language
solution.explanation: Vituperated - censured with harsh and abusive language.

question: Naina is leaving and I am  think to apply  for  her job. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: thinking about applying ‘Am’ is a helping verb of Present Continuous Tense and ‘is/am/are + V ing ’ is the correct grammatical structure. ‘About’ is

question: Malati has a diﬃcult job, but she does it  good  . SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: well The given sentence needs an adverb(well) to modify the meaning of the verb ‘does’, not an adjective(good). Hence, ‘well’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He travelled the whole world, but found  piece  at home. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: No substitution required   (b) prize   (c) peach   (d) Peace

solution.explanation: peace ‘Piece’ means a portion of an object or a material while ‘peace’ means a state of being calm and free from any kind of worry or disturbance.The word ‘peace’ makes the sentence meaningful. Hence, ‘peace’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Farmers have harvested wheat  by using whatever labour that was available to them. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: by using dispersed labour    (b) by using amalgamated labour

solution.explanation: by using limited labour ‘Limited’ means a small quantity or number of something. The given sentence states that farmers have harvested their wheat by using a small number of labourers. Hence, ‘by using limited labour’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: You  can  become  conﬁdent  to  speak  English  within  one year. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: conﬁdent in speaking ‘In’ is used after the word ‘conﬁdent’ to show the speciﬁc area or subject in which someone is conﬁdent. Hence, ‘conﬁdent in speaking’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  unexpected  turn  beside  the  project  put  the  company in a big ﬁnancial crisis. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: No substitution required      (b) between the project
options.C: until the project                     (d) in the project

solution.explanation: in the project ‘In’ is used to indicate involvement while ‘beside’ is used to show that two things are close to each other. The given passage talks about the impact of unexpected change in the project. Hence, ‘in the project’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Politics and money  go together  in this country. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Go hand in hand - go together.

question: The decision to engage in an armed conﬂict  is  tacit  . SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (1st Shift)

options.C: incomprehensible for some  (d) implied without being stated

solution.explanation: Tacit - implied without being stated.

question: The cat climbed a tree and  perched  itself on  a branch. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.A: perked  (b) perished  (c) No substitution required  (d) parched

solution.explanation: No substitution required The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: Fifty rupees  feels  too much for such a pen. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: seems ‘Feels’ is used for the sense of touch or emotion and ‘seems’ is used to show what something appears to be. The word ‘seems’ makes the sentence meaningful. Hence, ‘seems’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Despite of  an injury, he won the match. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Despite ‘Despite’ means in spite of and it doesn't take any preposition with it. Hence, ‘Despite’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Lily  has dedicate  her life towards becoming  a doctor. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: has dedicated “Has/Have/Had + V 3 (third form of the verb)” is the correct grammatical structure. However, the third form of ‘dedicate’ is ‘dedicated’. Hence, ‘has dedicated(V 3 )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Health  insurance  are  important  today  since  anyone  can face a medical emergency without warning. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: is important According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a singular subject always takes a singular verb. Similarly, ‘Health insurance’ is a singular subject that will take ‘is’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘is important’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It was  a quite  afternoon, so Dan decided to  take a nap. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: a quiet (b) an quite (c) No substitution required (d) an quiet

solution.correct_answer: A. a quiet (b) an quite (c) No substitution required (d) an quiet
solution.explanation: a quiet ‘Quite’ is used to emphasize the degree or extent of something and ‘quiet’ describes something that makes no noise. Similarly, in the given sentence, it is stated that it was a quiet afternoon. Hence, ‘a quiet’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: People  say different things at different times  . SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: There  are  three  cars  parked  outside:  a  Mercedes,  an  Jaguar
options.B: There  are  three  cars  parked  outside:  an  Mercedes  ,  a  Jaguar
options.C: should say fanciful things at different times
options.D: There  are  three  cars  parked  outside:  a  Mercedes,  an  Jaguar

solution.correct_answer: A. There  are  three  cars  parked  outside:  a  Mercedes,  an  Jaguar
solution.explanation: say diverse things at different times ‘Different’ is used to indicate that two or more things are not the same or not alike in some way. whereas ‘diverse’ means a wide range of differences within a group or a set of things. Hence, ‘say diverse things at different times’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Andrew  will playing  basketball at the college  tournament. SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (1st Shift)

options.B: are play      (c) is playing       (d) is played

solution.explanation: is playing ‘Is/am/are + V ing ’ is the correct grammatical structure for Present Continuous Tense. ‘Andrew’ is a singular subject that will take ‘is’ as a singular verb. Hence, ‘is playing(V ing )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Selling,  purchasing,  and  using  an  illegally  copied  product is a criminal offence. SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (1st Shift)

options.A: an obsolete   (b) a pirated   (c) an outlawed   (d) a crooked

solution.explanation: a Pirated - illegally copied.

question: With all their little comforts destroyed, the  survivors were thrown  still farther back into barbarism  . SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.D: still a little farther into barbarism

solution.correct_answer: B. still further back into barbarism
solution.explanation: still further back into barbarism ‘Farther’ is used to indicate the physical distance while ‘further’ is used to indicate the ﬁgurative/metaphorical distance. Hence, ‘still further back into barbarism’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: He said that  I have ﬁnished my work  . SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: he had ﬁnished his work         (b) he has ﬁnished his work

solution.correct_answer: A. he had ﬁnished his work         (b) he has ﬁnished his work
solution.explanation: he had ﬁnished his work . The given sentence is an example of indirect speech as the conjunction 'that' has been used after the verb 'said'. As per the rules of Indirect speech, the pronouns 'I' and ‘My’ change into 'He' and ‘His’ and ‘Present perfect (have + V 3 ) changes to past perfect (had + V 3 ). Hence, 'he had ﬁnished his homework' is the most appropriate answer.

question: Many great people  born  in that small village. SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

options.A: was born (b) No substitution required (c) is born (d) were born

solution.explanation: were born We generally use the passive voice when the subject is unknown or unimportant. According to the “Subject-Verb Agreement Rule”, a plural subject always takes a plural verb. Similarly, ‘people’ is a plural subject that will take ‘were’ as a plural verb. Hence, ‘were born’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: It  is  true  that  learning  English  is  essential  for professionals  to  survived  the  national  and  international competitions. SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: for surviving ‘For’ is used to indicate the purpose or reason of something. Similarly, the given sentence states the purpose of learning English. We generally use gerund(V ing ) after a preposition(for). Hence, ‘for surviving(V ing )’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Peer  pressure  is  bound  to  effect  most  of  us  both positively and negatively. SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.correct_answer: B. to affect most of us
solution.explanation: to affect most of us We generally use the ﬁrst form of the verb(V 1 ) after the preposition ‘to’. ‘Affect’ is the verb form of the noun ‘effect’. Hence, ‘to affect(V 1 ) most of us’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  pandemic  has  challenged  education  systems  to ensure  learning  continuity,  substantially  increasing  the  demands placed on teachers. SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: No substitution required. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: Mohan  unknowingly  altered  salt  instead  of  sugar  to  the dessert making it taste terrible. SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (1st Shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. added salt instead of sugar
solution.explanation: added salt instead of sugar ‘Alter’ means to change the form of something & ‘add’ means to put in an additional element or ingredient. The word ‘added’ is a more precise and clear choice in this sentence. Hence, ‘added salt instead of sugar’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: No  sooner  did  he  ﬁnished  his  examination  than  he  left for his cricket training centre. www.ssccglpinnacle.com                                                 Download Pinnacle Exam Preparation App Search on TG: @apna_pdf Pinnacle Sentence Improvement SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (2nd Shift)

options.C: no sooner than he did ﬁnished (d) no sooner had he ﬁnish

solution.explanation: but it is impossible We generally use the conjunction ‘but’ to express a different opinion or idea. Hence, ‘but it is impossible’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Can you please tell me where  is the city park. SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. where the city park is?
solution.explanation: where the city park is? Whenever Wh. Words(like who, whom, where, why, how, etc) are written in the middle of a sentence, the helping verb and the main verb are written after the subject. E.g. - I do not know where she lives . Therefore, ‘is’ will be used after the subject ‘city park’. Hence, ‘where the city park is’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: This  hill  is  a  nice  place  to  meditate  because  one  can enjoy solitude. SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: No fewer than ‘Fewer’ is used when we are comparing countable objects i.e. pedestrians. Hence, ‘No fewer than’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: How  do  you  think  the  internet  has  inﬂuenced  how  we utilise  news and media? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.correct_answer: D. has impacted the way we consume
solution.explanation: has impacted the way we consume The word "consume" means to take in information or media and the phrase "has impacted the way we consume" states the idea of change in the way we take in digital content. Hence, ‘has impacted the way we consume’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Meenakshi  called  out  for  the  neighbourhood  to  get support for her campaign. SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (4th Shift)

solution.explanation: called around the neighbourhood The phrase ‘call around’ means making calls or contacting different individuals or locations. The given sentence states that Meenakshi contacted or reached out to various people or places within her neighborhood to seek support for her campaign. Hence, ‘called around the neighbourhood’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Despite  facing  numerous  obstacles  and  setbacks,  the determined  entrepreneur  refused  to  give  up  on  her  dream  of creating a successful startup  that would transform  the sector  . SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: D. that would revolutionise the industry
solution.explanation: that would revolutionise the industry ‘Revolutionise’ means to bring about signiﬁcant change or transformation in something, which has the same meaning as the phrase “that would transform the sector”. question: Amal  brightened  of  when  they  said  he  could  go  with them. SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

question: From  a  recent  research,  evident  is  it  that  a  lot  more women  have been opting for professional  courses. SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (2nd Shift)

question: She is the  least reliablest  person of all. SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: least reliable ‘Least / most reliable’ is the correct superlative degree of ‘reliable’. Hence, ‘least reliable’ is the most appropriate answer.

solution.explanation: experimenting with different techniques The phrase ‘experimenting with different techniques’ means trying out various methods to achieve a goal. question: The  students  were  restored  to  complete  the  assignment by Friday. SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: expected ‘Expect’ means to think that something will happen. The word ‘expect’ makes the sentence meaningful. Hence, ‘expect’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The  GDP  of  the  country  has  g  rowth  ra  p  idl  y  since independence. SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: has grown rapidly ‘Has/have/had + V 3 ’ is the correct grammatical structure. Hence, ‘has grown(V 3 ) rapidly’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: She had an ability to  persuade  others. SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (1st shift)

solution.explanation: Impress- to make a strong impact or inﬂuence on someone. Persuade- to convince or inﬂuence someone to do something. Halt- to pause or to stop for a short period of time. Suppress- To stop or prevent something. Outrage- to make someone angry by repeating an inappropriate behaviour.

question: We  must  remember  that  what  we  teach  our  children  is what we  inculcate  in them. SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (1st shift)

Endanger- to put someone or something at risk or in a dangerous situation. Inspire- to motivate or encourage someone. Import- to bring in goods or services from another country.

question: The  fact  that  God  created  man  in  his  personal  view  by giving  him  an  intellectual  spirit  elevates  him  above  the  beasts  of the ﬁeld. SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (2nd shift)

question: The  frog adopts itself  to live both in water  and on land. SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: frog adapts itself ‘Adapt’ means to become adjusted to new conditions. In the given sentence, the frog is adjusting or modifying itself to live both in water and on land. While, ‘Adopt’ means to legally take (another's child) and bring it up as one's own. And ‘Adept’ means a person who is skilled or proﬁcient at something. Hence, ‘frog adapts itself’ is the most appropriate answer.

Betraying- to be disloyal to someone or something. Cheating- to act dishonestly or unfairly in order to gain an advantage. Revealing- to make something known that was previously hidden.

question: The  Indian  independence  movement  sought  to  establish the  conceptions  of  freedom  and  social  welfare  as  the  goals  of an  independent  Indian  state,  resulting  in  Fundamental  Rights and Directive Principles. SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (2nd shift)

question: Carolina  opened  a  savings  account  to  save  money  for later  . SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (3rd shift)

question: The management is not  beware of  this fact. SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (4th shift)

Therefore, ‘beware of’ must be replaced with ‘aware of’ to make a grammatically correct structure. Hence, ‘Aware of’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Please ask the dog to  get of my  couch. SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (2nd shift)

question: The  mob  drove  on  the  rampage  and  looted  several  shops in the locality. SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (2nd shift)

question: I  don’t wear  the sunglasses at the moment. SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (3rd shift)

solution.explanation: I’m not wearing The phrase ‘at the moment’ describes an action happening right now. And we generally use present continuous tense(is/am/are + V-ing) to denote an action happening at the current moment. Hence, ‘I’m not wearing’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Her hopes for building her own  house were beaten  when she lost her jewellery box. SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (3rd shift)

question: Irene went to oﬃce  every single day by walk  . SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (4th shift)

question: In  today's  digital  age,  information  is  widely  available  to everyone  by  many  means  of  media  such  as  television, newspapers, ﬁlms, and social media. SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)

In the given sentence, various types of media have been listed, such as television, newspapers and ﬁlms. Hence, ‘via various forms’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Abhijeet feels  extremely tired  after working  all day long. SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (3rd shift)

question: Brian  remained  silent  during  the  board  meeting,  though Rahul  was  unaware  that  he  had  an  ace  up  his  sheath  the  entire time. SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (4th shift)

question: Abraham Lincoln has been the sixteenth president  of the United States and  save the Union at  the American Civil  war. SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (2nd shift)

question: There  is  a  charm  on  the  midnight  air  which  all  cannot experience. SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (1st shift)

question: Being  a  practiced  liar,  it  was  totally  normal  for  him  to utter a  complete and blatant lie  . SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (3rd shift)

question: The rebels  laid up  their arms Graduate Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 4)

question: Raju did very well in the exam  ,  he must study  well  . SSC CHSL Tier II  (26/06/2023)

SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Evening)

Hence, ‘whom’ is the most appropriate answer.

We use the article ‘a’ before the words starting with a Consonant(B,D,F,N,etc.) for example, a dirty shirt, a neglected department, etc. However, the article ‘an’ is used before words starting with a Vowel(A,E,I,O,U) or a Vowel Sound for example, an educated person, an honest policy, etc. Hence, ‘many an hour(starting with a vowel sound)’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: What a  palace  home! SSC CHSL 04/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: Let’s look into the meaning of the given words in the options Palatial - (used about a room or building) like a palace; extremely large and spacious. Pushy - trying hard to get what you want, in a way that seems rude. Palatable - (used about food or drink) with an agreeable or pleasant taste. Here, ‘palatial’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: We  were  quite  impressed  with  the  enthusiasm  that  she work for  . SSC CHSL 04/08/2021 (afternoon)

solution.explanation: that she worked with. The given sentence is in the Past Tense. so ‘worked with’ will be used in place of ‘work with’.

question: The child is crying  because she can't ﬁnd  her mother. SSC CHSL 04/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: No improvement. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: The roof  is being held up over  two stone pillars. SSC CHSL 04/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: ‘Is held up by’ should be used in place of ‘ is being held up over ’.The use of 'being' is incorrect as it is used in present or past continuous tense. ‘Being’ is used in the passive sense and it is incorrect as per the context of the given sentence.The roof is held up by two stone pillars. Hence, option (d) is the correct answer.

question: Small  desert  animals  burrow  underground across the days  and come out only at night. SSC CHSL 06/08/2021 (Morning)

solution.explanation: during the day ‘Across the days’ should be replaced with ‘during the day’.So the correct sentence will be “Small desert animals burrow underground during the day and come out only at night”.

question: The  workers’  union  has  threatened  for  going  to  an indeﬁnite strike. SSC CHSL 06/08/2021 (Evening)

solution.explanation: Threaten means to warn that you may hurt, kill or punish somebody if he/she does not do what you want. Similarly, the given sentence states that the workers union has threatened to go on an indeﬁnite strike. However, threaten will take the preposition ‘to’ with it. Hence, ‘for going to’ will be replaced by ‘ to go on ’ to grammatically correct the sentence.

question: A  heavy  ﬁne  will  be  inﬂicted  with  them  if  they  do  not  pay the taxes in time. SSC CHSL 09/08/2021 (afternoon)

options.A: will be inﬂicted for them         (b) will be inﬂicted of them
options.C: No substitution required         (d) will be inﬂicted on them

solution.explanation: Inﬂict means to force somebody to have something unpleasant or something that he/she does not want. However, Inﬂict takes the preposition ‘on’ with it. Hence, ‘will be inﬂicted on them’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Regard  of  whether  the  students  were  ready  or  not  the teacher announced the dates of the test. . SSC CHSL 11/08/2021 (Morning)

options.C: No substitution required             (d) Regardless of whether

solution.explanation: Replace ‘Regard of whether’ with ‘Regardless of whether’ to make the sentence grammatically correct because the teacher was regardless of the students whether they were ready or not. Regardless is a formal word, and it is generally used in formal situation.

question: He  lost  his  heart  because  he  could  not  cope  with  the diﬃcult situation. SSC CPO Tier II (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: ‘ Lost heart ’ is an idiom that means to begin to feel that one cannot do something that one has been trying to do. Similarly, in the given sentence, he could not cope with the diﬃcult situation so he lost heart. Hence, ‘ lost heart ’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: His ﬁne voice  has never heard  in this hall  again. SSC CPO Tier II (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: We generally use ‘again in a sentence to indicate that something happens a second time so obviously, it will happen in the future and for it, we will use a verb of the future tense(will). Hence, ‘ will never be heard ’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: I am much taller  than I was a year ago. SSC CPO Tier II (26/07/2021)

options.A: that I were a year ago
options.B: as I was the year before

solution.explanation: No Substitution. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question: He  went to foreign  for higher education. SSC CPO Tier II (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: ‘Abroad’ means in/to a foreign country & we generally use abroad as an adverb in phrases like go/went abroad . So, the phrase ‘went to foreign’ is contextually incorrect. Similarly, the given sentence states that he went abroad for higher education. Hence, ‘went abroad’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: What  kind of the book  do you want? SSC CPO Tier II (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: The article ‘the’ is used to refer to speciﬁc or particular nouns . However, in the given sentence, ‘book’ is not particularly speciﬁed so it can be any book. So, we will remove the article ‘the’ before ‘book’. Hence, ‘kind of book’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: The porter  denied to take  the money. SSC CPO Tier II (26/07/2021)

solution.explanation: ‘Deny’ is always followed by a gerund(V-ing) and never by an inﬁnitive (with the preposition ‘to’) for example he denied seeing me, he denied giving me, etc. Similarly, the given sentence states that Porter denied taking the money. Hence, ‘denied taking’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Because  she didn’t love him, she had to marry  him. SSC CPO  23/11/2020 (Morning)

options.A: No substitution required  (b) Although  (c) Since  (d) Despite

solution.explanation: Although as a conjunction means ‘and yet, but’. According to this sentence, she didn't love him ,and yet she had to marry him. Hence, ‘although ’ will be the most appropriate answer.

question: When  challenged  ,  the  man  had  no  answer  for  his actions. SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: No substitution required. The sentence is grammatically correct.

question: She walked  among me  without greeting me. SSC CPO 23/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: To ‘walk past’ means to overcome or overlook something that has happened. For example, you were walking

question: Every  year  the  family  goes  for  a  pilgrim  to  the  temple  at Tirupati. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Morning)

options.C: No substitution required       (d) on a pilgrimage

solution.explanation: Whether we ‘go to somewhere’(go to market) or we ‘go on a trip/tour’. In this question, the family goes on a tour(pilgrimage). Hence, ‘on a pilgrimage’ will be the most appropriate answer.

question: The mare hurt its hooves  when running to  the  forest. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: While means ‘during this time’. It is used to show the duration for an activity. However, the given question states that the mare hurt its hooves during running. Hence, ‘while running through’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: A large  swarm of  dogs was blocking the way. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Morning)

solution.explanation: pack of. Swarm - A large group of insects, especially bees. Pack - Group of speciﬁc canines like wolves and dogs. Hence, ‘A pack of dogs’ will be the most appropriate answer.

question: The train was delayed  in order to  an accident. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: The phrase ‘In order to’ means “so that” and the phrase ‘Owing to’ means ‘because of’. For example, The match was cancelled owing to(because) bad weather. Similarly in the given question, the train was delayed because of an accident. Hence, ‘ owing to ’ will be the most appropriate answer.

question: The large mansion was  over his reaching  . SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: beyond his reach. The phrase ‘Beyond someone's reach’ is used to show that something is not close enough to be touched or picked up by someone and not within someone's power to do or achieve. Similarly, for the given question, ‘the mansion was beyond his reach’ will be the most appropriate answer because it means that it is not possible for him to buy that expensive mansion.

question: Suman performed  at the festival well yesterday  . SSC CPO 25/11/2020 (Evening)

options.A: at the festival yesterday well  (b) No substitution required
options.C: well at the festival yesterday  (d) yesterday at the festival well

solution.correct_answer: C. well at the festival yesterday  (d) yesterday at the festival well
solution.explanation: well at the festival yesterday According to the “ MPT rule ”, the standard word order for adverbs from starting to end is as follows: Adverb of Manner (How), Adverb of Place( Where), Adverb of Time (When). Similarly in this given sentence, She performed well(Manner) at the festival(Place) yesterday(Time) will be the most appropriate answer.

question: The exam was not  so easy that  we had expected. SSC CPO 25/11/2020 (Evening)

solution.explanation: as easy as. ‘So____that’ is a conjunction which is used to show the purpose, but when we compare things, we use the structure ‘as___as’. Hence, ‘the exam was not as easy as we had expected’ is the most appropriate answer.
